section.p: After calling this method, the SDK stops audio and video interaction, leaves the current channel, and releases all resources related to the session. After joining a channel, you must call this method to end the call, otherwise you cannot start the next call.

After calling this method, the SDK stops all audio and video interactions and releases all resources related to the session. You must call this method after joining a channel to end the call; otherwise, you cannot start the next call.

ul.li: If you call immediately after this method, the SDK does not trigger the callback.
This is an asynchronous method. When the method returns, it does not mean the user has completely left the channel.
If you joined multiple channels using , calling this method leaves all the channels you joined.
If you call immediately after this method, the SDK does not trigger the callback.
This method is asynchronous. When it returns, it does not mean the user has completely left the channel.
If you joined multiple channels using , calling this method leaves all the channels you joined.

section.title: Timing
section.p: Call this method after joining the channel.
Call this method after joining a channel.

section.title: Related Callbacks
section.p:
After this method is successfully called, the SDK triggers the following callbacks:
Local client: Triggers the callback.
Remote client: Triggers the callback when the remote host leaves the channel.

After this method is successfully called, the following callbacks are triggered:
Local client instance: Triggers the callback.
Remote client instance: When the remote host leaves the channel, the callback is triggered.

ul.li:
< 0: Failure.
-1: A general error occurred (no specific reason).
-2: Invalid parameter.
-7: SDK not initialized.

< 0: Failure.
-1: A general error occurs (no specific reason).
-2: Invalid parameter.
-7: SDK is not initialized.
